channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sarah Mullally named first woman Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally has been named as the new Archbishop of Canterbury, becoming the first woman to be chosen to lead the world's 85 million Anglicans.

item.title: Mexico: The cumbia DJs of the streets
item.description: One of the most listened-to genres in the Americas, photographers and storytellers Karla Gachet and Ivan Kashinsky document cumbia in Colombia, Mexico...

item.title: AI's getting better at faking crowds. Here's why that's cause for concern
item.description: Odd fingers and faces in the crowd of a recent Will Smith concert video led to suspicions of AI. But AI is improving fast, and there are serious impli...

item.title: México: Los DJs de cumbia del barrio
item.description: Uno de los géneros más escuchados en las Américas, los fotógrafos Karla Gachet e Iván Kashinsky documentan la cumbia en Colombia, México, Ecuador, Per...

item.title: Shutdown postpones monthly jobs report. And, Trump dangles a carrot to colleges
item.description: The government shutdown has delayed the monthly jobs report. And, the White House pressures colleges to sign a 'compact' aligning with Trump's agenda.

item.title: Celebrations in Luxembourg as new Crown Duke sworn in
item.description: Grand Duke Henri of Luxembourg has abdicated, handing over the throne to his eldest son, Grand Duke Guillaume.

item.title: Trump gives Hamas Sunday deadline to accept Gaza peace plan
item.description: The 20-point proposal seeks to end the fighting immediately in return for the release of hostages and detained Gazans.

item.title: Trump administration taps Army Reserve and National Guard for temporary immigration judges
item.description: The Trump administration is tapping National Guard and Army Reserve lawyers to be temporary immigration judges after firing dozens of existing judges.

item.title: Police race to save murder evidence from being turned into scrap metal
item.description: Police say the driver of the minivan — who wore a mask, glasses and a hard hat — sprayed security cameras with blue paint to hide his crime inside an ...

item.title: As U.S. hiring slows, more Americans are job hunting for months
item.description: The number of unemployed people looking for work more than six months has surged to its highest level since 2021.

item.title: "Kindness 101" lesson on grief shows how kids found healing after loss
item.description: In this week's "Kindness 101," Steve Hartman and his children explore the lesson of grief. They revisit the Schoper family, where three young kids fou...

item.title: Four Gaza flotilla activists deported by Israel
item.description: The four already deported are Italian citizens, the Israeli foreign ministry says.

item.title: Trump sets Sunday deadline for Hamas to agree to Gaza peace deal
item.description: President Trump said Friday that he is issuing a Sunday evening deadline for Hamas to agree to a U.S. peace proposal, backed by the Israeli government...

item.title: Fathers entitled to equal parental leave, South Africa's top court rules
item.description: The ruling grants both parents the right to share a total of four months and 10 days of parental leave.

item.title: Fans share first reactions to Taylor Swift's "The Life of a Showgirl"
item.description: Taylor Swift has released her new album "The Life of a Showgirl," which debuted at midnight and is already generating major buzz. Likely to be the yea...

item.title: Behind the Gen Z protesters who want to force Madagascar's president from power
item.description: President Rajoelina's move fails to quell the protest movement that is now threatening his own position.

item.title: FDA approves another generic abortion pill, prompting outrage from conservatives
Trump uses government shutdown to dole out firings and political punishment
